sn21.10:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn21.10:1.2: Now at that time there was a certain mendicant named Senior. He lived alone and praised living alone.
sn21.10:1.3: He entered the village for alms alone, returned alone, sat in private alone, and concentrated on walking mindfully alone.
sn21.10:1.4: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
sn21.10:1.5: “Sir, there’s a certain mendicant named Senior who lives alone and praises living alone.”
sn21.10:2.1: So the Buddha addressed a certain monk,
sn21.10:2.2: “Please, monk, in my name tell the mendicant Senior that
sn21.10:2.4: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to Venerable Senior and said to him,
sn21.10:2.6: “Yes, reverend,” that monk replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
sn21.10:2.7: “Is it really true, Senior, that you live alone and praise living alone?”
sn21.10:2.9: “But in what way do you live alone and praise living alone?”
sn21.10:2.10: “Well, sir, I enter the village for alms alone, return alone, sit in private alone, and concentrate on walking mindfully alone.
sn21.10:2.11: That’s how I live alone and praise living alone.”
sn21.10:3.1: “That is a kind of living alone, I don’t deny it.
sn21.10:3.2: But as to how living alone is fulfilled in detail,
sn21.10:3.3: listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
sn21.10:3.5: “And how, Senior, is living alone fulfilled in detail?
sn21.10:3.6: It’s when what’s in the past is given up, what’s in the future is relinquished, and desire and greed for present incarnations is eliminated.
sn21.10:3.7: That’s how living alone is fulfilled in detail.”
sn21.10:4.1: That is what the Buddha said.
sn21.10:4.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn21.10:5.2: is unsullied in the midst of all things.
sn21.10:5.3: He’s given up all, freed in the ending of craving:
sn21.10:5.4: I declare that man to be one who lives alone.”
